definition: each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
the back of a body or object/to turn one's back/to hide something from/to learn by heart/to recite from memory/unlucky (slang)/hard of hearing
to be burdened/to carry on the back or shoulder

sentences.english: Suppose you were exposed in the opposite position by your opponent, .
sentences.chinese: 假设你被敌手败露在相背的位置，。

definition: to conflict with (an idea or opinion etc)/to depart from (established norms or standards etc)
to fail to meet each other/to conflict with each other/to be at odds with
to run in parallel without hindrance/not mutually exclusive/two processes can be implemented without conflict
each one does what he thinks is right (idiom)/each goes his own way
to go against/to be contrary to/perverse/rebellious
to agree implicitly/of one mind/views coincide without a word exchanged
